segment.source: Create UE-V Settings Location Templates with the UE-V Generator
segment.target: Create UE-V Settings Location Templates with the UE-V Generator

segment.source: Create UE-V Settings Location Templates with the UE-V Generator
segment.target: Create UE-V Settings Location Templates with the UE-V Generator

segment.source: Create UE-V Settings Location Templates with the UE-V Generator
segment.target: Create UE-V Settings Location Templates with the UE-V Generator

segment.source: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) uses settings location templates to roam application settings between user computers.
segment.target: Microsoft User Experience Virtualization (UE-V) uses settings location templates to roam application settings between user computers.

segment.source: Some standard settings location templates are included with User Experience Virtualization.
segment.target: Some standard settings location templates are included with User Experience Virtualization.

segment.source: You can also create, edit, or validate custom settings location templates with the UE-V Generator.
segment.target: You can also create, edit, or validate custom settings location templates with the UE-V Generator.

segment.source: The UE-V Generator monitors an application to discover and capture the locations where the application stores its settings.
segment.target: The UE-V Generator monitors an application to discover and capture the locations where the application stores its settings.

segment.source: The application that is being monitored must be a traditional application.
segment.target: The application that is being monitored must be a traditional application.

segment.source: The UE-V Generator cannot create a settings location template from the following application types:
segment.target: The UE-V Generator cannot create a settings location template from the following application types:

segment.source: Virtualized applications
segment.target: Virtualized applications

segment.source: Application offered through terminal services
segment.target: Application offered through terminal services

segment.source: Java applications
segment.target: Java applications

segment.source: Windows 8 applications
segment.target: Windows 8 applications

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: UE-V templates cannot be created from virtualized applications or terminal services applications.
segment.target: UE-V templates cannot be created from virtualized applications or terminal services applications.

segment.source: However, settings synchronized using the templates can be applied to those applications.
segment.target: However, settings synchronized using the templates can be applied to those applications.

segment.source: To create templates that support Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) and terminal services applications, open a Windows Installer File (.msi) version of the application with UE-V Generator.
segment.target: To create templates that support Virtual Desktop Infrastructure (VDI) and terminal services applications, open a Windows Installer File (.msi) version of the application with UE-V Generator.

segment.source: Excluded Locations
segment.target: Excluded Locations

segment.source: The discovery process excludes locations which commonly store application software files that do not roam well between user computers or environments.
segment.target: The discovery process excludes locations which commonly store application software files that do not roam well between user computers or environments.

segment.source: The following are excluded:
segment.target: The following are excluded:

segment.source: HKEYCURRENTUSER registry keys and files to which the logged-on user cannot write values
segment.target: HKEYCURRENTUSER registry keys and files to which the logged-on user cannot write values

segment.source: HKEYCURRENTUSER registry keys and files associated with the core functionality of the Windows operating system
segment.target: HKEYCURRENTUSER registry keys and files associated with the core functionality of the Windows operating system

segment.source: All registry keys located in the HKEYLOCALMACHINE hive
segment.target: All registry keys located in the HKEYLOCALMACHINE hive

segment.source: Files located in Program Files directories
segment.target: Files located in Program Files directories

segment.source: Files located in Users User name AppData LocalLow
segment.target: Files located in Users User name AppData LocalLow

segment.source: Windows operating system files located in %systemroot%
segment.target: Windows operating system files located in %systemroot%

segment.source: If registry keys and files stored in these excluded locations are required in order to roam application settings, administrators can manually add the locations to the settings location template during the template creation process.
segment.target: If registry keys and files stored in these excluded locations are required in order to roam application settings, administrators can manually add the locations to the settings location template during the template creation process.

segment.source: Create UE-V templates
segment.target: Create UE-V templates

segment.source: Use the UE-V Generator to create settings location templates for line-of-business applications or other applications.
segment.target: Use the UE-V Generator to create settings location templates for line-of-business applications or other applications.

segment.source: After the template for an application is created, you can deploy the template to computers so users can roam the settings for that application.
segment.target: After the template for an application is created, you can deploy the template to computers so users can roam the settings for that application.

segment.source: To create a UE-V settings location template with the UE-V Generator
segment.target: To create a UE-V settings location template with the UE-V Generator

segment.source: Click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft User Experience Virtualization, and then click Microsoft User Experience Virtualization Generator.
segment.target: Click Start, click All Programs, click Microsoft User Experience Virtualization, and then click Microsoft User Experience Virtualization Generator.

segment.source: Click Create a settings location template.
segment.target: Click Create a settings location template.

segment.source: Specify the application.
segment.target: Specify the application.

segment.source: Browse to the file path of the application (.exe) or the application shortcut (.lnk) for which you want to create a settings location template.
segment.target: Browse to the file path of the application (.exe) or the application shortcut (.lnk) for which you want to create a settings location template.

segment.source: Specify the command line arguments, if any, and working directory, if any.
segment.target: Specify the command line arguments, if any, and working directory, if any.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Before the application is started, the system displays a prompt for User Account Control.
segment.target: Before the application is started, the system displays a prompt for User Account Control.

segment.source: Permission is required to monitor the registry and file locations that the application uses to store settings.
segment.target: Permission is required to monitor the registry and file locations that the application uses to store settings.

segment.source: After the application starts, close the application.
segment.target: After the application starts, close the application.

segment.source: The UE-V Generator records the locations where the application stores its settings.
segment.target: The UE-V Generator records the locations where the application stores its settings.

segment.source: After the process is complete, click Next to continue.
segment.target: After the process is complete, click Next to continue.

segment.source: Review and select the check boxes next to the appropriate registry settings locations and settings file locations to roam for this application.
segment.target: Review and select the check boxes next to the appropriate registry settings locations and settings file locations to roam for this application.

segment.source: The list includes the following two categories for settings locations:
segment.target: The list includes the following two categories for settings locations:

segment.source: Standard: Application settings that are stored in the registry under the HKEYCURRENTUSER keys or in the file folders under UsersUser nameAppDataRoaming.
segment.target: Standard: Application settings that are stored in the registry under the HKEYCURRENTUSER keys or in the file folders under UsersUser nameAppDataRoaming.

segment.source: The UE-V Generator includes these settings by default.
segment.target: The UE-V Generator includes these settings by default.

segment.source: Nonstandard: Application settings that are stored outside the locations specified in the best practices for settings data storage (optional).
segment.target: Nonstandard: Application settings that are stored outside the locations specified in the best practices for settings data storage (optional).

segment.source: These include files and folders under UsersUser nameAppDataLocal.
segment.target: These include files and folders under UsersUser nameAppDataLocal.

segment.source: Review these locations to determine whether to include them in the settings location template.
segment.target: Review these locations to determine whether to include them in the settings location template.

segment.source: Select the locations check boxes to include them.
segment.target: Select the locations check boxes to include them.

segment.source: Click Next to continue.
segment.target: Click Next to continue.

segment.source: Review and edit any Properties, Registry locations, and Files locations for the settings location template.
segment.target: Review and edit any Properties, Registry locations, and Files locations for the settings location template.

segment.source: Edit the following properties on the Properties tab:
segment.target: Edit the following properties on the Properties tab:

segment.source: Application Name: The application name written in the description of the program files properties.
segment.target: Application Name: The application name written in the description of the program files properties.

segment.source: Program name: The name of the program taken from the program file properties.
segment.target: Program name: The name of the program taken from the program file properties.

segment.source: This name usually has the .exe extension.
segment.target: This name usually has the .exe extension.

segment.source: Product version: The product version number of the .exe file of the application.
segment.target: Product version: The product version number of the .exe file of the application.

segment.source: This property, in conjunction with the File version, helps determine which applications are targeted by the settings location template.
segment.target: This property, in conjunction with the File version, helps determine which applications are targeted by the settings location template.

segment.source: This property accepts a major version number.
segment.target: This property accepts a major version number.

segment.source: If this property is empty, the settings location template will apply to all versions of the product.
segment.target: If this property is empty, the settings location template will apply to all versions of the product.

segment.source: File version: The file version number of the.exe file of the application.
segment.target: File version: The file version number of the.exe file of the application.

segment.source: This property, in conjunction with the Product version, helps determine which applications are targeted by the settings location template.
segment.target: This property, in conjunction with the Product version, helps determine which applications are targeted by the settings location template.

segment.source: This property accepts a major version number.
segment.target: This property accepts a major version number.

segment.source: If this property is empty, the settings location template will apply to all versions of the program.
segment.target: If this property is empty, the settings location template will apply to all versions of the program.

segment.source: Template author name (optional): The name of the settings location template author.
segment.target: Template author name (optional): The name of the settings location template author.

segment.source: Template author email (optional): The email address of the settings location template author.
segment.target: Template author email (optional): The email address of the settings location template author.

segment.source: The Registry tab lists the Key and Scope of the registry locations that are included in the settings location template.
segment.target: The Registry tab lists the Key and Scope of the registry locations that are included in the settings location template.

segment.source: Edit the registry locations by use of the Tasks drop-down menu.
segment.target: Edit the registry locations by use of the Tasks drop-down menu.

segment.source: Tasks include adding new keys, editing the name or scope of existing keys, deleting keys, and browsing the registry where the keys are located.
segment.target: Tasks include adding new keys, editing the name or scope of existing keys, deleting keys, and browsing the registry where the keys are located.

segment.source: Use the All Settings scope to include all the registry settings under the specified key.
segment.target: Use the All Settings scope to include all the registry settings under the specified key.

segment.source: Use the All Settings and Subkeys to include all the registry settings under the specified key, subkeys, and subkey settings.
segment.target: Use the All Settings and Subkeys to include all the registry settings under the specified key, subkeys, and subkey settings.

segment.source: The Files tab lists the file path and file mask of the file locations included in the settings location template.
segment.target: The Files tab lists the file path and file mask of the file locations included in the settings location template.

segment.source: Edit the file locations by use of the Tasks drop-down menu.
segment.target: Edit the file locations by use of the Tasks drop-down menu.

segment.source: Tasks for file locations include adding new files or folder locations, editing the scope of existing files or folders, deleting files or folders, and opening the selected location in Windows Explorer.
segment.target: Tasks for file locations include adding new files or folder locations, editing the scope of existing files or folders, deleting files or folders, and opening the selected location in Windows Explorer.

segment.source: Leave the file mask empty to include all files in the specified folder.
segment.target: Leave the file mask empty to include all files in the specified folder.

segment.source: Click Create and save the settings location template on the computer.
segment.target: Click Create and save the settings location template on the computer.

segment.source: Click Close to close the Settings Template Wizard.
segment.target: Click Close to close the Settings Template Wizard.

segment.source: Exit the UE-V Generator application.
segment.target: Exit the UE-V Generator application.

segment.source: After you have created the settings location template for an application, you should test the template.
segment.target: After you have created the settings location template for an application, you should test the template.

segment.source: Deploy the template in a lab environment before putting it into production in the enterprise.
segment.target: Deploy the template in a lab environment before putting it into production in the enterprise.

segment.source: Related topics
segment.target: Related topics

segment.source: Working with Custom UE-V Templates and the UE-V Generator
segment.target: Working with Custom UE-V Templates and the UE-V Generator

segment.target: Operations for UE-V 1.0
